metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14178 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
In snapd 2.27 through 2.29.2 the 'snap logs' command could be made to call journalctl without match arguments and therefore allow unprivileged, unauthenticated users to bypass systemd-journald's access restrictions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14178` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

snap-confine - 2.29.4.2~14.04
snapd - 2.29.4.2~14.04
snapd-xdg-open - 2.29.4.2~14.04
ubuntu-core-launcher - 2.29.4.2~14.04
ubuntu-core-snapd-units - 2.29.4.2~14.04
ubuntu-snappy - 2.29.4.2~14.04
ubuntu-snappy-cli - 2.29.4.2~14.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: snapd package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.29.4.2~14.04').
